events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 9th, describing damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords indicating vehicle collision and damage.
An claims agent was assigned to manage the case and was notified about the specifics of the auto accident reported.
Acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer that the process to review the auto accident claim has begun.
Requested a copy of the police report and photographs of the vehicle damage from the insured to proceed with the assessment.
Received the requested police report and multiple photos showing the extent of the car damage involved in the accident.
The investigation team began evaluating the claim details, reviewing the submitted documents and vehicle damage evidence.
Concluded the investigation confirming the accident circumstances and damage assessments are consistent with the claim.
A settlement offer based on repair estimates and damage evaluation was proposed to the insured for approval.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciation for the expedient handling of the case.
Claim approval was granted following agreement on the settlement terms and confirmation of the validity of the accident claim.
Insurance payment was processed and issued to the customer’s account to cover the agreed repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
The claim was officially closed after confirming the payment was received and the customer’s satisfaction with the resolution.
